Key Match Events: Josh Hart had 23 points, 15 rebounds, and 10 assists for his third triple-double of the season
Karl-Anthony Towns had 32 points and 13 rebounds
Jonas Valanciunas equaled his season high with 22 points
Alex Sarr and Malcolm Brogdon each had 18 points
New York’s OG Anunoby hit two 3-pointers to break a 63-all tie with 9 minutes to play in the third quarter, and the Knicks never trailed after that
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks were too good for the youthful Wizards even though Brunson had only 18 points, leaving the scoring load to his teammates
Playing back-to-back games against one of the NBA’s best teams was too much for the overmatched Wizards
Post-Match Reflections: There was a scary moment with 3:07 to play in the third quarter when Washington rookie guard Bub Carrington fell backward while guarding a player and hit a Knicks player’s knee and then the back of his head on the court
Carrington left in a wheelchair, covering his face and did not return with a post-traumatic headache
Miscellaneous Highlights: Washington played their second straight game without leading scorer Jordan Poole, who’s out with a bruised left hip
Kyle Kuzma returned after missing 12 games with a strained left rib
